text: Artificial intelligence will be an engine of economic growth around the world. I gathered energy, AI, and data center leaders in Aberdeen to discuss how South Dakota can help the United States win the AI race against China. https://t.co/hrgcl9UdCa

Today, we remember those who didn’t come home from combat. Our nation owes a debt of gratitude to the servicemembers who served our country and were held as a prisoner of war or missing in action. They will never be forgotten. https://t.co/ogkZUIsXhI

Happy Birthday to the U.S. Air Force! I join in celebrating the legacy of excellence in the Air Force with the men and women who have served at Ellsworth Air Force Base and across South Dakota. https://t.co/vfmKyQpI1b

I’m glad to see that @Interior is rolling back a Biden-era Public Lands Rule that would have prohibited many activities on multiple-use lands. Americans should be able to use these lands as they see fit – from livestock grazing to mining to recreation.

https://t.co/lOnF5RMFUE

It’s National Truck Driver Appreciation Week. Truck drivers are the backbone of our economy, keeping food, products and fuel moving across the country. South Dakota employs more than 30,000 people in the trucking industry.
Thank a truck driver today! https://t.co/AFLBN45bQw

Black Hills Works provides employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities and veterans on AbilityOne federal contracts in South Dakota. I got to meet with Mark to hear how AbilityOne has provided him the opportunity for mission-driven employment at Ellsworth Air Force Base.
I had an incredible time substitute teaching at Lincoln High School today. I learned a lot from the students and faculty. https://t.co/2ehHDgx4R2

Thank you, @POTUS for approving $500,000 of disaster relief for the Sisseton-Wahepton Oyate Tribe. The need for this relief was part of our conversation when I visited last month.

I joined @LeaderJohnThune and @SenatorRounds a few days ago to ask for this relief and I am grateful for the administration’s quick response.
I’ll never forget the tragic day of September 11, 2001. I join with the rest of America to reflect on 9/11 and honor those who served and those who lost their lives. https://t.co/LFFSsSfvZi

Praying for Charlie Kirk and his family. 

Political violence has no place in our country.

Congrats to Howard High School, Jones County Middle School, and Warner Elementary School for being selected as National Blue Ribbon Schools. These schools are great examples of excellent education in South Dakota.

Martin will soon be home to a brand-new hospital serving Southwestern South Dakota. I was pleased to join the community in celebrating the Bennett County Hospital groundbreaking. This hospital will benefit from the historic rural hospital transformation fund that I recently voted to pass.

I voted to stop Chinese fentanyl from coming into the U.S. For too long Chinese officials have not taken appropriate steps to curb the flow of fentanyl ingredients into the U.S. This legislation will allow for sanctions on individuals for their role in supplying the fentanyl crisis.

China should never have access to our government systems—especially those at the Department of Defense. 

I’m grateful the Trump Administration is putting America first and protecting our country from the national security threat the Chinese Community Party poses.

I joined the residents of Peaceful Pines Senior Living to talk about my work in Congress and how the One Big Beautiful Bill benefits seniors. We talked about a wide range of issues from prohibiting members of Congress from trading individual stocks and my efforts to counter the growing influence of China.

I joined the Sioux Falls Chamber for a discussion on my work in Washington. We talked about a wide range of topics including agriculture, trade, and economic development. I also highlighted my legislation to ban individual stock trading by members of Congress and the many wins in the One Big Beautiful Bill for South Dakota’s economy.

Silencer Central is the leading manufacturer of firearm suppressors in the U.S. I stopped by to discuss how the One Big Beautiful Bill eliminates the tax on suppressors, short-barreled rifles, and short-barreled shotguns. I was honored to receive an award for my support of the Second Amendment in Congress.

The Chabad Jewish Community Center in Sioux Falls will be the first of its kind in South Dakota. Chabad is a Hebrew acronym which stands for Chochmah, Binah, and Da’at, which translates to wisdom, understanding, and knowledge. It was great to be there for the groundbreaking alongside Rabbi Mendel Alperowitz.

Through the One Big Beautiful Bill, students pursuing technical careers at trade schools will be eligible for Pell Grants, further improving our education, training, and our workforce.

Thank you to Sherrif Pat West for hosting a law enforcement appreciation event in Sturgis to thank officers for their tireless protection of our state. The One Big, Beautiful Bill is a strong conservative work product, and one that is long overdue. It delivers a historic spending reduction and roots out abuse of federal programs. These changes are a meaningful attempt to turn our fiscal house in the right direction.

Our Democrat colleagues have consistently misrepresented the One Big, Beautiful Bill. The Republican Main Street Caucus is setting the record straight. Work requirements for SNAP do NOT affect seniors, those with disabilities, or those with young children at home. https://t.co/o9OUsaMkW6
It increases mining of domestic minerals, decreasing our reliance on countries like China.
It increases onshore and offshore oil and gas leases, unleashing American energy.
It replenishes our Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
It provides critical funding for rural schools on national service lands.
It boosts defenses against foreign animal diseases that threaten our livestock and poultry industries.
It doubles funding for trade programs so American-grown products reach more global markets.
It prevents over 2 million family-owned farms from being burdened by the death tax.
It makes long-term investments in conservation efforts that protect working lands without tying producers’ hands.
It strengthens risk management tools for American farmers facing higher costs for fuel, feed, and fertilizer.
It removes SNAP eligibility for non-citizens, ensuring Americans who need assistance the most receive it.
It removes 1.4 million illegal immigrants from Medicaid, protecting the program for the neediest Americans.
It protects the Highway Trust Fund by ensuring EVs pay their fair share.

It enforces work requirements for able-bodied adults without dependents who receive SNAP or Medicaid benefits, helping to lift them out of poverty. These will not affect pregnant women, seniors, those with disabilities, or those with young children at home.
It strengthens the Coast Guard to bolster drug enforcement and secure our maritime border.
It makes historic investments in air traffic control, bringing technology into the 21st century.
It stops the Biden-era rule that would have required Venmo, PayPal, and gig transactions over $600 be reported to IRS.
It defunds Planned Parenthood.
It prohibits taxpayer-funded sex changes for minors.
It terminates Green New Deal giveaways for EV chargers and luxury “clean vehicles.”
It decreases taxes on Social Security.
It stops taxes on tips and overtime to support our police, health care workers, and service employees.
It expands 529 education savings accounts, allowing parents more options to provide education opportunities to their kids.
It makes the adoption tax credit more usable for families.
It doubles the Child Tax Credit to $2,500, supporting families.
It provides an average $5,000 in savings for Americans earning between $30,000-$80,000 per year, a 15% reduction in their tax bill.
It helps 80% of American families by avoiding the largest tax increase in American history.
Its tax rates save 6 million jobs, including 1.1 million manufacturing jobs.
It expands ICE’s capacity to detain 100,000 illegal immigrants at any time.
It hires 10,000 new ICE personnel and 3,000 Border Patrol agents.
It funds “Remain in Mexico” enforcement and at least one million annual removals of illegal aliens, ensuring immigrants come to the U.S. the right way.

It secures our southern border by completing 701 miles of primary walls, 900 miles of river barriers, 629 miles of secondary barriers, replacing 141 miles of vehicle and pedestrian barriers, and strengthening border surveillance technology.
It is the largest deficit reduction in a generation with $1.6 trillion in mandatory savings.
The One Big, Beautiful Bill is PACKED with common-sense, conservative wins. Here are 32 examples.
